intro: Hypecoum refractum, commonly known as the purple mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are borne on erect, branching stems and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Hypecoum refractum is adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
